title: How to Cook a Turkey Crown

methods.name: Roasting an Herb Buttered Turkey Crown

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 390 °F (199 °C) and mix together an herb butter.
steps.description: Put 9 tablespoons (125 g) of softened unsalted butter into a small bowl. Chop the leaves from 3 to 4 sprigs of fresh thyme and 1 sprig of fresh rosemary. Add these to the butter along with 2 tablespoons (7.5 g) of freshly chopped parsley leaves, salt, and pepper to taste. Stir to completely combine the ingredients.

steps.headline: Rub the herb butter under the skin of the turkey crown.
steps.description: Get out a 4 to 5 pound (1.8 to 2.2 kg) turkey crown and use your fingers to pull up the skin of the turkey away from the flesh. Scoop the herb butter underneath the skin and rub it evenly between the skin and the flesh. Set the turkey crown in a roasting pan so the skin side is facing up.

steps.headline: Roast it for 15 minutes, reduce the heat, and cook it for 1 1/2 hours.
steps.description: Turn the heat down to 350 °F (177 °C) and cook the turkey crown until juices run clear when you poke it with a knife. This should take 1 1/2 hours.

steps.headline: See if the temperature is at 170 °F (77 °C).
steps.description: To tell if the turkey has finished cooking, insert an instant-read meat thermometer into the thickest part. If it hasn't reached 170 °F (77 °C), return it to the oven to cook for 30 more minutes before checking the temperature again.

steps.headline: Rest the turkey for 30 minutes.
steps.description: If it's reached 170 °F (77 °C), cover it loosely with aluminum foil and let it rest for 30 minutes. The turkey crown will finish cooking and the juices will redistribute within the meat.

steps.headline: Serve the herb butter turkey crown.
steps.description: Set the turkey crown on a cutting board and use a sharp knife to slice it for serving. Serve the hot turkey crown with pan gravy, rolls, roasted sweet potatoes, and steamed vegetables. Refrigerate any leftovers in an airtight container for 3 to 4 days.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C) and butter the turkey crown.
steps.description: Get out a 4 1/2 pound (2 kg) turkey crown and set it in a roasting pan. Use your fingers to spread 3 1/2 tablespoons (50 g) of softened butter over the entire turkey crown.

steps.headline: Season the turkey crown with salt and half of the Chinese five spice.
steps.description: Sprinkle salt according to your taste over the top of the turkey crown. Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of the Chinese five spice or a small pinch of ground cloves over the crown.

steps.headline: Roast the turkey crown for 30 to 40 minutes.
steps.description: Ensure that the turkey crown is facing skin side up and put it in the preheated oven.

steps.headline: Mix together a quick glaze.
steps.description: Put the remaining 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of Chinese five spice into a small bowl. Whisk in 4 tablespoons (85 g) of honey, 1 tablespoon (15 g) of Dijon mustard and 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of red wine vinegar to make a glaze.

steps.headline: Baste the turkey crown with half of the glaze and roast it for 1 hour.
steps.description: Remove the turkey crown from the oven and use a pastry brush or spoon to coat the crown with half of the glaze. Return the uncovered roasting pan to the oven and cook the turkey crown for 1 more hour. Baste the turkey crown 1 to 2 more times while it bakes. The glaze will caramelize as it cooks so it may be sticky.

steps.headline: See if the temperature is at 170 °F (77 °C).
steps.description: Insert an instant-read meat thermometer into the thickest part of the turkey crown to see if it's finished cooking. If it hasn't reached 170 °F (77 °C), return it to the oven to cook for 20 to 30 more minutes before you check it again.

steps.headline: Rest the turkey for 20 minutes.
steps.description: Cover the cooked turkey crown loosely with aluminum foil and let it rest for 20 minutes. It will finish cooking and the juices will redistribute within the meat.

steps.headline: Serve the turkey crown.
steps.description: Set the turkey crown on a cutting board and use a sharp knife to carve it into slices. If you want, make a gravy using the drippings from the roasting pan. Serve the turkey crown with roasted parsnips, brussels sprouts, or glazed carrots. Refrigerate the leftovers in an airtight container for 3 to 4 days.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 425 °F (218 °C) and weigh the turkey crown.
steps.description: Check the package to see how much the turkey crown weighs and write it down. If the package doesn't say, weigh the turkey crown on a scale. Knowing the weight will help you calculate the cooking time. Plan on cooking the turkey crown 20 minutes for every 2.2 pounds (1 kg) and then 70 minutes on top if the turkey crown weighs less than 8 pounds (4 kg). If it weighs more, cook it 20 minutes for every 2.2 pounds (1 kg) and then 90 minutes on top.

steps.headline: Butter and season the turkey crown.
steps.description: Take 3 1/2 tablespoons (50 g) of softened butter and use your fingers to rub it over the entire turkey crown. Sprinkle salt and freshly ground pepper over the top of the turkey crown. The butter will keep the turkey moist as it bakes and will make the skin crisp up.

steps.headline: Lay the bacon over the top of the turkey crown.
steps.description: Get out 10 strips of bacon and lay each strip over the top of the turkey crown so the turkey is completely covered. The bacon will keep the turkey from drying out and will become crisp as it bakes.

steps.headline: Bake the bacon covered turkey crown for 25 to 30 minutes.
steps.description: Set the turkey crown in a roasting tray and put it in the middle of the preheated oven. Bake the turkey crown at this high heat just so the bacon cooks completely. This should take 25 to 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the bacon and baste the turkey crown.
steps.description: Remove the roasting tray from the oven and use tongs to take the bacon off of the turkey crown. Put the bacon on a serving plate and cover it with aluminum foil. Use a pastry brush or turkey baster to baste the turkey crown with some of the cooking juices.

steps.headline: Reduce the oven temperature to 350 °F (177 °C) and cook the turkey crown for 1 1/2 hours.
steps.description: If you're cooking a 4 to 5 pound (1.8 to 2.2 kg) turkey crown, cook the turkey just until the juices run clear when you poke the thickest part of the turkey breast. Depending on the size of the turkey crown, you may need to cook it for an additional 20 to 30 minutes.

steps.headline: See if the temperature is at 170 °F (77 °C).
steps.description: Insert an instant-read meat thermometer into the thickest part of the turkey crown to see if it's finished cooking. If it hasn't reached 170 °F (77 °C), return it to the oven to cook for 20 to 30 more minutes before you check it again.

steps.headline: Rest the turkey crown for 20 minutes.Remove the turkey crown and cover it loosely with aluminum foil.
steps.description: Rest it for 20 minutes so the juices redistribute and the turkey finishes cooking.

steps.headline: Serve the turkey crown.
steps.description: Use a sharp serrated knife to carve the turkey crown before setting it on a platter. Arrange the reserved cooked bacon next to the turkey crown and serve them with your favorite sides such as roasted potatoes, brussels sprouts, and mashed potatoes with gravy.Store the leftover turkey crown in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 days.
